channel.title: My first & second model
channel.description:
This is technically not my first model. I have made half of a sword before but wasn't happy with it so I just deleted it. So, this is my first model that I have actually completed. I do plan to do more on this later on.
By the way, this took me a seemingly long time to finish considering what it is. It is also pretty thin so it doesn't look 3D and may not look sharp. But I can assure you it is. If you would like me to post more pictures to prove this, then I will if I have to.
!!! MY SECOND MODEL PICTURES HERE NOW !!!
Greatsword Whole view: [img]http://i25.tinypic.com/2dgkdc9.jpg[/img]
Greatsword hilt view: [img]http://i32.tinypic.com/2cdvqmw.jpg[/img]
Greatsword blade view: [img]http://i26.tinypic.com/10cq13a.jpg[/img]
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This is my master sword so far. It has turned out looking almost nothing like the original Legend of Zelda models. But it is a start. By the way, this is only the blade. I still need to make the hilt, handle and pummel. I will upload other pictures when I am finished. But, tell me what you guys think of it so far.
Master Sword blade view #1: [img]http://i31.tinypic.com/2z6dsw8.jpg[/img]
Master Sword blade view #2: -- Will upload tomorrow --
Master Sword blade view #3: -- Will upload tomorrow --
Master Sword symbol view: -- Will upload tomorrow --
Sorry, I will upload more pictures tomorrow, my computer is running really slow and I have to go to bed :| Please, post and tell me what you think.

item.title: My first & second model
item.description:
@14-08 wrote:

If you are trying to add your own models you don’t need RSMV. Unless, of course you are trying to add or edit a model from RSMV. The Models folder should be with all the other RSMV files.

Hope you were actually talking about RSMV.

Read full topic

item.title: My first & second model
item.description:
@14-08 wrote:

No problem, i just dislike it when people underestimate my abilities. i know my criticism can be annoying at times. i also think we should try n start off on the right foot.

No, it wasn’t your criticism. It was my low temper threshold

And, yes, I agree.

But, once again, I apologize for all my pointless bull-shit.

 ~~ 14-08

Read full topic

item.title: My first & second model
item.description:
@14-08 wrote:

Was it your first model, though? Not just your first trace. I mean, it was an excellent model… and i don’t want to be mean. So, let’s try again, Dylan.
— Hi, I’m 14-08.

(By the way, I am sorry if what I said was mean, I didn’t mean to, I just get offended easily).

Read full topic

item.title: My first & second model
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

[quote=“14-08, post:27, topic:296110”]Why would I link the hilt to the blade? Because the sword would fall apart if I didn’t

Anyway, why did you bother going to that much effort when you didn’t even prove me wrong. Read my post again, I didn’t say you can’t trace, I just said that I doubt that you could make a model look better than the original.[/quote]
i didnt read the ‘better than origional part’, and it only took 45 mins to make the trace

Read full topic

item.title: My first & second model
item.description:
@14-08 wrote:

Why would I link the hilt to the blade? Because the sword would fall apart if I didn’t

Anyway, why did you bother going to that much effort when you didn’t even prove me wrong. Read my post again, I didn’t say you can’t trace, I just said that I doubt that you could make a model look better than the original.

Read full topic

item.title: My first & second model
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

[quote=“14-08, post:25, topic:296110”][quote]First model:
the hilt looks fragile, too thin. the way that you connected the blade, hilt, and handle is VERY unrealistic. hilt ,blade ,and handle should all be separate objects, as a real sword. splitting the 3 up gives it the effect that its not just like every other trace here. the way the hilt connects to the blade just, no… dont do that again. the hilt should be thicker than the blade. i noticed a glitched area in the blade, fix it.

Second model:
why mess with the master sword? it nearly never turns out well when modelled, which i guess you never noticed from the last few. Mastersword only looked good in the zelda games, not in meta.[/quote]

If this is supposed to be constructive criticism. It wasn’t very good.
In the first model, the hilt, blade and handle are all separate. I just linked them badly. The reason I ‘mess around with the master sword’ is because, well, it is quite simple. And, as you’ve made out, I am a bad modeler. This is why I ‘mess around with the Master Sword’. The only Legend of Zelda game that the Master Sword looks good in was in The Ocarina of Time and back then the sword only had like 900-1000 faces. In my opinion, messing around with the Master Sword is a good thing.

But, to be entirely honest with you, I don’t think even you could trace and make it look better than the original picture or model. If you disagree then prove me wrong. [/quote]
Tracing is easy. i could out-trace most of you here. and “ocarina of time” is the zelda game i was referring to. why would you link the hilt to the blade?

Read full topic

item.title: My first & second model
item.description:
@14-08 wrote:

First model: the hilt looks fragile, too thin. the way that you connected the blade, hilt, and handle is VERY unrealistic. hilt ,blade ,and handle should all be separate objects, as a real sword. splitting the 3 up gives it the effect that its not just like every other trace here. the way the hilt connects to the blade just, no... dont do that again. the hilt should be thicker than the blade. i noticed a glitched area in the blade, fix it.

Second model:
why mess with the master sword? it nearly never turns out well when modelled, which i guess you never noticed from the last few. Mastersword only looked good in the zelda games, not in meta.

If this is supposed to be constructive criticism. It wasn’t very good.
In the first model, the hilt, blade and handle are all separate. I just linked them badly. The reason I ‘mess around with the master sword’ is because, well, it is quite simple. And, as you’ve made out, I am a bad modeler. This is why I ‘mess around with the Master Sword’. The only Legend of Zelda game that the Master Sword looks good in was in The Ocarina of Time and back then the sword only had like 900-1000 faces. In my opinion, messing around with the Master Sword is a good thing.

But, to be entirely honest with you, I don’t think even you could trace and make it look better than the original picture or model. If you disagree then prove me wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: My first & second model
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

First model:
the hilt looks fragile, too thin. the way that you connected the blade, hilt, and handle is VERY unrealistic. hilt ,blade ,and handle should all be separate objects, as a real sword. splitting the 3 up gives it the effect that its not just like every other trace here. the way the hilt connects to the blade just, no… dont do that again. the hilt should be thicker than the blade. i noticed a glitched area in the blade, fix it.

Second model:
why mess with the master sword? it nearly never turns out well when modelled, which i guess you never noticed from the last few. Mastersword only looked good in the zelda games, not in meta.

Read full topic
